title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'plan six-week break and Thanksgiving in the US'
text:

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex will take six weeks off from Royal duties for "family time" - including Archie's first Thanksgiving in the US.

The time-off follows Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's ten-day tour of South Africa.

Speaking ahead of ITV's documentary which will be aired the first time tonight, host Tom Bradby said the royal couple appeared 'vulnerable and bruised".

Prince Harry, 35, reportedly also voiced his desire to leave the UK, describing Cape Town in South Africa as 'an amazing place to be able to base ourselves', according to The Sunday Times .

(Image: ITV News / Mirror Grab)

However, he admitted that it would be an 'very difficult', if not impossible, move.

Harry and Meghan are hoping to build a traditional bush lodge in Botswana, where Harry visited last month, it is claimed.

A source said: "They would love to build a traditional bush lodge, constructed by locals, bringing work and trade to the land.

"There has also been talk of a local school being built as well.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"Most importantly they want somewhere where they have complete privacy and will not be disturbed."

The couple are believed to take on baby Archie to the US in November to celebrate Thanksgiving in Los Angeles, where Meghan's mother Doria lives.

Then they are expected to spend their first Christmas with the Queen and other members of the Royal Family at Sandringham Palace in Norfolk.

A royal source told the Sunday Times: "The Duke and Duchess have a full schedule of engagements and commitments until mid-November, after which they will be taking some much-needed family time."
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex will take their son Archie to LA for Thanksgiving before spending Christmas at Sandringham, say reports
